newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler int'l sales up 11 pct in May.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler int'l sales up 11 pct in May.

text.p: Chrysler Corp said Friday it sold 19,638 vehicles in May in markets outside North America, an 11 percent increase from May 1996, when Chrysler's international sales were 17,688.
Sales for the calendar year to date were 94,999, up eight percent from a year ago.
Chrysler said its Europe May sales were 10,145 units, a 22 percent increase. The United Kingdom was Chrysler's top international market in May, with sales up 173 percent from a year ago.

Latin America sales in May increased to 3,586 vehicles versus 1,352 a year ago. Brazil sales were 856 vehicles, up from 10 last year; Venezuela finished the month with sales of 1,425, compared with 314 in May 1996.
Overall Asia Pacific sales declined 30 percent, while Middle East/Africa sales were down 8 percent from a year ago.
"We are seeing the positive sales effects of offering a full range of right-hand-drive vehicles," said Francois J. Castaing, executive vice president for international operations.
